website_summaries.verdict: Easy to clean with foolproof instructions on the rotating handle.
pros: High marks for its ability to cook crisp waffles
Can throw the iron pieces in the dishwasher when done
Flips with ease and has a collapsible handle for easy storage
We love that it comes with recipes as well

customer_reviews.title: This isnt a terrible waffle iron
customer_reviews.text: This isnt a terrible waffle iron, but it is very inconsistant.. one half of the waffle gets done or burned while the other is not completely cooked! Poor quality HB.
customer_reviews.author: e stew

customer_reviews.title: Looks good but performs badly.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace my old heavy duty waffle maker that lasted me a decade. This thing looks good out of the box but it makes terrible waffles. Soggy in the middle unless you really let it get burned on the outside. And took about 10 minutes to make a waffle half way decent. Back to the box and returned the same day we tested it.
customer_reviews.author: Pedro

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Have had this waffle maker for a short time. made about 5 waffles for freezing. Every waffle was cooked evenly. The waffle maker did overflow once, but I think I over filled it. The non-stick is great. I only sprayed oil on the first waffle and the following did not stick. Easy to clean plates. Love that they come off. Wish this waffle maker would have a beep alert for ready but it only has a ready light. Also doesn’t have automatic shut off. However, I did leave the waffle in about a minute past ready indicator and the waffle was still good. So far I am happy. Will update post if any of the negatives occur.
customer_reviews.author: Ada Kow

customer_reviews.title: Horrible in so many ways.
customer_reviews.text: I’d been using a $20 Walmart waffle maker previously and decided it was time to “upgrade.” This appliance was a complete disappointment. It may be that mine is defective, but even when I push the handle down (to unlock), it’s ridiculously hard to turn. The waffles themselves came out either crunchy or dense and floppy. It’s nice that the plates come out, but there’s an area in the back that holds dried batter and cooking spray hostage. It doesn’t respond to any sort of negotiation attempts. All in all, a total waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Hatcher

customer_reviews.title: The waffles are pretty thick. If you want crispier waffles either let ...
customer_reviews.text: I decided to.do a small upgrade from my other Hamilton beach waffle stick maker. (Hamilton Beach 20640) The waffles are pretty thick. If you want crispier waffles either let them bake longer or use less.water. mine came out perfect every time. Even when there isn't enough batter to make a whole waffle you could just make a waffle in one of the corners and have a mini 1/4 waffle. Without overspill into the next corner. I'm very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: A. A. Lochan

customer_reviews.title: Followed the instructions and set off to make my first ...
customer_reviews.text: Followed the instructions and set off to make my first waffle. But wouldn't get brown, just s soggy bog mallow. Tried a second, wouldnt even get past a warm soup. Sending it back and hoping the next one works.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Great little waffle maker
customer_reviews.text: As I researched on-line, this waffle maker was listed as one of the best. The reviews were decent so I tried it. As another reviewer had mentioned, the first waffle is the worst and as you make more it gets better. Truth. As instructed, I brushed the plates with vegetable oil the first time I used it. I had no problem with the waffle sticking to the grills. I used Krusteaz pancake mix and followed the recipe on the bag. I set the waffle maker to 1 1/2 and when the ready light was green, poured almost 1 cup of batter. 5 minutes later, we had beautiful waffles. One recipe made 4 whole waffles. Very happy with it!
customer_reviews.author: warriors

customer_reviews.title: Stopped heating after 12 plug-ins.
customer_reviews.text: Have been using the waffle maker for 6 weeks now. Loved it at first. Made great waffles. No complaints. The heating control and rotating base looked and felt cheap but it worked great so thought it was not an issue. Well here I am 6 weeks later and something is obviously wrong with the unit. It no longer heats properly and my waffles never fully cook. They stay soggy and never brown after 15 minutes! Being that I have tried all the settings with no change I have to assume something went wrong internally. Bad quality product.
customer_reviews.author: M. D Lion

customer_reviews.title: Breakfast of Champions
customer_reviews.text: I made the statement a week or so before my birthday while making waffles on a cheap waffle maker that "if I had a waffle iron that was easy to clean I'd make waffles all the time." Well, fast forward to my birthday and this beauty appeared. It cooks perfect waffles every time and the plates pop out and go in the dishwasher like a dream. It heats evenly and turns upside down which helps the waffles release better. It doesn't take up much space on my counter, either. True to my word, we have waffles quite frequently now. I've had to come up with a low-carb version to keep pace with our love for them.
customer_reviews.author: Mad Cassandra

customer_reviews.title: Great waffle iron with removable plates!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this after staying at a bed-and-breakfast where they made waffles for breakfast. This particular waffle iron is excellent. Do not be fooled into buying the slightly cheaper version without removable plates. You want to be able to remove the plates and clean them. This is tremendously important. Enjoy!!
customer_reviews.author: la mamma di Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic! Gets the jobs done!
customer_reviews.text: Love this iron! Love that the plates can be removed to be cleaned. Makes my waffles golden and crispy the way they should be. I do wish the cord was able to retract back into the iron, so it makes storage neater. But overall this is a great iron
customer_reviews.author: Victoria

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: I wish it had more removeable components so I could fully clean it by throwing it in the dish washer. EDIT: So really, you get what you pay for. For whatever reason though, I didn't get far more for the price paid because there's some well-kept secret to waffle technology apparently.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: non stick coating wears off super fast
customer_reviews.text: After a year of very light use and exclusive hand washing, the non stick coating is coming off at all the corners of the wells. Should definitely have lasted longer. Disappointed with how cheaply it's made.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole P Ziegler

customer_reviews.title: Perfect waffles every time
customer_reviews.text: This waffle iron makes the best belgian waffles! I used the waffle maker the second it was delivered. I made a homemade waffle mix. The waffles turned out big, fluffy and beautiful! None of my waffles stuck to the grid. Even the first waffle turned out nice. Cooks fast. Enjoy how I can control the how I want the waffles cooked. Super easy to clean. Love the drip pan!
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: Easy clean-up
customer_reviews.text: So easy to take apart and clean! The inserts come straight out and the little tray is removable. I love making waffles and it does make perfect crunch on the outside but soft in the inside waffles. I've also used batter with berries in it and it came out delicious (though I did have to bump up the setting for it). I will say I would have considered getting a more expensive model that had an audible timer instead of just the green light for ready. Still it performs perfectly as described and hasn't failed me yet!
customer_reviews.author: Troi

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: It works. I got it because I needed an additional one for another residence. My other waffle maker is the Waring Pro. The HB waffle maker is way less expensive but it's not as nice. It heats uneven, so the front section can be browned and the rear still very light. it also doesn't have a beeper to tell you when it's ready, just a green light , so you can't pour one and sit down.
customer_reviews.author: Dale G. Montondo

customer_reviews.title: Works Well.
customer_reviews.text: First use, worked like a charm. Came single boxed so it was visible. Used Bisquick batter, worked well. First time out waffles were a bit dark, I’d suggest starting at lowest setting. Also said to use cooking spray, I’d pass on that as well. Nice easy clean up once the grates have been brushed with vegetable oil. It’s about 5 minutes to completely cook a waffle. Seems well made, directions were clear and informative.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Moan

customer_reviews.title: Deffective
customer_reviews.text: Waffles took 15 minutes to solidify at highest setting, never fully cooked. Entire time waffle maker was on you could hear a high, then low click sounding like a reed switch relay kicking on and off. Nov 2, 2017.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Our grandchildren love Belgium waffles and this appliance produced some spectacular breakfasts ...
customer_reviews.text: Our grandchildren love Belgium waffles and this appliance produced some spectacular breakfasts for them very easily. The only thing I did not particularly like was the user guide. It was not very clear about when the waffle would be done. Also, the waffle recipe included was not very inspiring and I ended up searching for one online. I found one by a well known chef and the Hamilton Beach Maker performed well.
customer_reviews.author: Big Daddy

customer_reviews.title: It's just stupid. That aside
customer_reviews.text: So far, no complaints! I've probably used it for waffles about 4 times. The biggest selling point is the removable plates. Why, oh why, would you ever manufacture a waffle maker without removable plates. It's just stupid. That aside, the con to this thing is once it's on, it never stops heating up. It doesn't run up to a temperature and then shut itself off to avoid burning itself out, this thing will gladly run and run and smoke off the whole non-stick coating if you let it. It'd be better if there was a safety thermal switch in the device. Other than that, I don't believe you'll be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Utz

customer_reviews.title: Belgian Waffle Maker
customer_reviews.text: We like the waffle maker. It took a while to get the cook time down. The first several batches of waffles were too undercooked and not good. But after we ruined a bunch, we figured out how long to leave them in the waffle maker to get them to be crisp and firm.
customer_reviews.author: PL

customer_reviews.title: With a good recipe, this is amazing
customer_reviews.text: We've used it a handful of times so far and I love it. I recommend using a waffle recipe designed for Belgian waffles with this. We've done both, and the Belgian waffle recipe was so much lighter and easier to eat. I'm looking forward to many more lazy Sunday waffles in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy C

customer_reviews.title: A Winner
customer_reviews.text: If you want a reliable little waffle maker without paying through the nose, this is a keeper. The heat adjustment works well, if you want anything from soft & chewy to brown & crispy. We've had an assortment of waffle maker over the years...some quite expensive with lots of bells and whistles. This little Hamilton Beach is a great little waffler...despite the one at a time limitation.
customer_reviews.author: Gordon B Smith

customer_reviews.title: Not thrilled
customer_reviews.text: This simply is not as good as the last waffle maker I owned. The waffles seem always to be soft. I found if I want to make sure they snap and crunch when served I really need to leave them on the griddle for a while which slows the whole process down. The family loves waffles and I am preparing to spend the stupid money and buy a commercial waffle maker for the house.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald P Staller

customer_reviews.title: This one stood out to me because of the removable plates for easy cleaning. The only negative to this waffle maker ...
customer_reviews.text: I have wanted a flippy waffle maker for quite some time. This one stood out to me because of the removable plates for easy cleaning. The only negative to this waffle maker is that each waffle takes quite a while. The directions say 6 minutes but we had to do 8 minutes otherwise it was undercooked. Thats over 30 minutes to make waffles for a family of four. Either someone is going to have a cold waffle or the cook will be eating alone as everyone else is already done eating.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica N.

customer_reviews.title: Great for making waffles - dont trust the "Ready' Light - would be nice to have a timer instead.
customer_reviews.text: Great waffle maker, setting for crispness of outside of waffle is a great feature... don't care much for the 'Ready' light not very accurate or reliable - comes on whenever it feels like it, would have liked a timer instead. So since the light is unreliable and no timer I use the timer on my phone or on the our oven.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Mathis

customer_reviews.title: Feels cheap - You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for - worked fine out of the box, but feels cheap. If a part doesn't need to be metal, it isn't. Much more plastic in construction that I expected - I expected the base and parts that support the actual waffle maker' to be more solid - I'm (perhaps pessimistically) expecting the stand to break with use. As long as I get my money's worth - the next waffle maker will at least be 'shopped' at a brick and mortar store, and probably not Hamilton Beach.
customer_reviews.author: bob nissen

customer_reviews.title: The iron is easy to use and the removable plates make cleaning super ...
customer_reviews.text: After going back and forth for years on buying a waffle maker I finally bought the Hamilton Beach. We wanted the flipping style and I wanted the removable plates. It took some time to find a recipe and setting that resulted in our preferred waffle, but we eventually found it. The iron is easy to use and the removable plates make cleaning super easy. I am sure if they weren't removable they would heat better, but I've always hated washing kitchen equipment with electronics inside. Alton Brown's waffle recipe, while complicated, has been the best one that we've tried when it comes to crispiness and flavor. I don't think I could ever use a pre-made mix after that.
customer_reviews.author: James Sadler

customer_reviews.title: I'm happy with it
customer_reviews.text: I took a gamble and bought the "used" item from Amazon Warehouse. The box was damaged but had its original factory seal and the unit itself was pristine. It makes really nice waffles, but it's not quite as sturdy as I had hoped. Overall I'm very pleased with it for the price. I would have liked a "nicer" one, but for 1/4 the price of the one I really wanted, I'm not at all disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie Harrison

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: This is pretty easy to use and very easy to clean. The only reason I took off a star is that the waffles take a while to cook (7-8 minutes) and the only heat setting that worked for me was minimum heat, the other settings just burn the waffle no matter what type of batter I use. To clean it you just take out the waffle grids and drip pan and wash it, you can put it in the dishwasher but I recommend hand washing.
customer_reviews.author: Janet smith

customer_reviews.title: Great waffle maker
customer_reviews.text: It was a tad bit larger than i thought however its the best, once my waffle was done i kept it on the lowest setting and it sis not burn it just stayed hot. Waffles over pancakes any day.
customer_reviews.author: Kizzy

customer_reviews.title: Great waffle maker
customer_reviews.text: It’s a great little waffle maker, the only downside is it lacks a function to let you know when the waffles are done. The removable plates make clean up super easy, just pull them out and toss them in the dishwasher.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Asch

customer_reviews.title: Decent waffle maker
customer_reviews.text: Works well overall. I found it's much easier to leave the handle turned to the side and use it that way for flipping than straight out. Also, waffles don't cook evenly, due to how the coils are shaped (the light part of the waffle lines up with the section with no coil). Love the removable plates though, way easier to clean than my old one.
customer_reviews.author: J. Lord

customer_reviews.title: This item appears to have been damaged/used.
customer_reviews.text: I wish I could give it less than 1 star. When I received the Hamilton Beach Flip Belgian Waffle Maker I noticed that the box was damaged and more tape had been added to seal the box. When I opened the box I could clearly see that the packaging had been tampered with. The handle is very shaky. I ordered this waffle maker for my niece's bridal shower brunch tomorrow. I am very disappointed with this purchase. I am returning it to Amazon today!!!
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Rodgers

customer_reviews.title: Waffles anyone?
customer_reviews.text: used this for the first time, and was able to use it the first time with no problems. Easy to fill, lock and flip. As far as use, i would give it 5 stars, but wish it had a light to let you know when the waffle is cooked. its a guessing came until you use it multiple times. After some trial and error the waffles came out crunch on outside, and light on the inside. would recommend
customer_reviews.author: terrie terrific

customer_reviews.title: Use almost daily
customer_reviews.text: I never knew I needed a waffle maker in my life but now this appliance stays on the counter and gets used almost daily in our house. Easy enough for the kids to do on their own. Plates detach for cleaning which is nice. I have nothing bad to say about this appliance, it works great and perfect waffles every time!
customer_reviews.author: Loren family

customer_reviews.title: Perfect waffles!
customer_reviews.text: We love our new HB Flip Waffle Maker! The design works well to ensure even browning of the waffles and the temperature setting is nice to have. My husband likes his waffles "extra crispy" and the high setting does the trick! So far ZERO complaints. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: K.M.

customer_reviews.title: Easy, delicious, and fun!
customer_reviews.text: This waffle maker is one of the best purchases I’ve made. It’s great to be able to make waffles easily and pretty foolproof! I like to add fruit to my waffles, like fresh strawberry or blueberries, and this waffle maker always makes them perfect. It’s also very convenient that you can take the irons and bottom tray off and just throw them in the dishwasher. Love this thing!
customer_reviews.author: Frances

customer_reviews.title: Buying this is causing me to gain weight because waffles are delicious.
customer_reviews.text: I'd been wanting a waffle iron for years. We had a few similar to this in my college dorm. When I saw this for 50% off during black Friday, I HAD to have it. I have since gained about 10-15lbs because waffles are delicious. In more seriousness, this is great. If you can find a good malt that doesn't have excess sugar, you can try a few interesting things with it. I like using waffles to make things like sandwiches because they're really crisp flavor prisons. So you don't always have to slather it in syrup - you can add in some meats, some vegetables, and call it a party.
customer_reviews.author: K Holmes

customer_reviews.title: I bought the waffle iron 3 months ago and didn't use it till this morning thinking I would be able to make nice waffles like my
customer_reviews.text: Results: half-cooked, thin waffles every time. Very disappointing, especially considering the cost. I bought the waffle iron 3 months ago and didn't use it till this morning thinking I would be able to make nice waffles like my old waffle iron. Boy was I disappointed. The only good feature is the removable plates. I really regret buying this waffle iron. I should have kept my old one. :-( Now, I have to look for another.
customer_reviews.author: Edna Ryles

customer_reviews.title: SIMPLE, WELL-DESIGNED, AND EASILY REMOVED (CLEANABLE) WAFFLE PLATES
customer_reviews.text: In my view, for the price, this is the best, most well-designed Belgian waffle maker available on Amazon. Its easy to use, and above all, its one of the few (if not the only) waffle maker with removable plates, making it easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Wingnut

customer_reviews.title: Best waffle maker I've ever owned.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is SUPER easy to use, and to clean. I ended up having to throw my old one out because the plates couldn't be removed, and it had a little accident with cheese. Not a problem, for this iron! Just pop those plates out, and you're golden.
customer_reviews.author: OkayestMom

customer_reviews.title: Waffles come out evenly browned
customer_reviews.text: I honestly do love it. Works much better than costlier ceramic waffle maker I had before. Removable grids for washing are great. Just remember to give them a light coat of oil before cooking. Waffles come out evenly browned. Also keep a plastic fork on hand to remove waffle so you don't scratch the grid surface.
customer_reviews.author: S.P.

customer_reviews.title: I've loved this, surprisingly so
customer_reviews.text: I've loved this, surprisingly so. It had been recommended by a young woman on her cooking blog, and though I had a fairly new waffle maker, was convinced this was worth a try. What a gem! Relatively inexpensive, it has outshined the other makers I've had. Less mess, even browning on the outside, thorough cooking inside, deep "pockets" in the waffles, grids easy to remove and clean, and cleaning the rest of the appliance is easy. I do keep the browning setting on the higher end, for all recipes.
customer_reviews.author: Joanne

customer_reviews.title: Good Waffle Maker and A Breeze To Clean
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this due to reviews it received on Amazon. Very pleased so far. Have used it two or three times. I purchased because everyone talked about how much easier it is to clean with the removable grids. I believe it says you can put these in the dishwasher but I've been hand washing them because I just feel it will make the nonstick substance last longer. As many on Amazon stated, if you want crisp waffles you need to wait about 3 minutes past when the "Ready" light comes on the first time. If you're looking for a good quality, easy to use and clean waffle maker, I really believe you'll like this one.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia B.

customer_reviews.title: Great Product, Great Waffles, Easy to Clean
customer_reviews.text: So glad that I bought this. It's compact, easy to use and understand, and super easy to clean. The stainless steel and plastic outside wipes down spotlessly, and the non-stick coated press washes off effortlessly. I can't really say that the thing cooks better or worse than any other product, as it's literally just a heating element that warms two iron pads you pour batter into. But, the timer it comes with is nice - although annoying at times - and it locks into an upright stance so it won't flop around in the cupboard. For the price, I would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Greyhound1211

customer_reviews.title: Good unit for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this because of removable grids. Got what I wanted, do not have a dishwasher, except for me. Very easy clean up. Non-stick coating is a little disappointing. Used Crisco spray and batter still got "hung up" on upper grid. I suppose to get something with really good non-stick qualities you have to go to the higher $ units. Don't eat enough waffles to worry about it. Takes a little trial and error to find correct setting in order to get them done the way you like. Also, will depend on whether you use a mix or scratch. All in all a good unit.
customer_reviews.author: Fat Rabbit

customer_reviews.title: Easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, this waffle maker didn't come with recipes, but I found one online. While there were some light spots, the waffles were cooked through, lightly crisp on the outside, and soft on the inside. In other words - delicious. The darkness can be adjusted so I will try a higher setting next time. The removable plates make them convenient to clean, although nothing stuck to them. They only needed a gentle brushing. Overall, I love this waffle maker and it came at a good price.
customer_reviews.author: T. Hollins

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I mean, it is an awesome waffle maker. I use it probably once a month. 1 cup of batter makes one whole waffle, so plan accordingly if you're feeding a family. It is easy to clean and operate, just follow the instructions and don't try and wing it.
customer_reviews.author: Mallory Hayes

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for in a waffle iron
customer_reviews.text: Great design. Finally a waffle iron with removable plates! You get crispy, evenly-cooked waffles at a fraction of the price of some other irons. The temperature control is very handy as well. Some of the nonstick coating rubs off from the bottom of the plates at the initial washing stage, but doesn't seem to be an issue. I am only handwashing to prolong the life of the plates, but they are apparently dishwasher safe (as long as you don't use the sanitize function).
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Easy, convenient, very satisfied
customer_reviews.text: I love being able to remove the waffle plates to wash them. Makes clean up a breeze.
customer_reviews.author: Sunny Beach

customer_reviews.title: Quality of baking
customer_reviews.text: I like very much that is so easy to clean the grid, but it does not bake evenly the whole surface of the waffle. I used only once so far and while the center of the waffle is the desired brown color, the margins are almost white.
customer_reviews.author: MVL

customer_reviews.title: Large but easy to clean waffle-maker. The waffles are larger than my head; they last for days.
customer_reviews.text: This is a hard one to review: it does the job. I find it too large for storing in a small condo kitchen, so for that, i take off one star. I am not a cook and I have no kitchen skills, so the plastic liner that slides underneath really helps me keep the messy waffle mix off the counter. I love that about it. I see no reason at all to actually need to flip my waffle, for it to cook evenly, so that part of the waffle maker is wasted on me.
customer_reviews.author: My Hummel OpinionTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: love this waffle maker
customer_reviews.text: love this waffle maker. It makes Great waffles. The plates come out easily with the touch of a button. I put EXACTLY one cup of batter in when the iron is on after just a couple of minutes. You should not get any drip if you use just this amount of batter. I don't wait for the ready light. It spreads more easily with a spoon before the iron is too hot. I use a very light Pam spray. Once the batter is in, I close the cover and wait about 30 seconds before I flip. When the steam stops coming out from the sides, they're done !
customer_reviews.author: weedz

customer_reviews.title: The first time I used this I was disappointed. The waffles came out flat and didn't cook ...
customer_reviews.text: The first time I used this I was disappointed. The waffles came out flat and didn't cook all the way through. My husband suggested I use a Belgium waffle recipe. I did that and the waffles were fantastic! Golden, fluffy and yummy. Using the waffle maker is a breeze. Assembly took 1 minute (literally)! After each use I just removed the top and bottom plate as well as the drip pan. I popped them all in the dishwasher and pulled them back out like any other dish. The lights on the machine make cooking foolproof.
customer_reviews.author: SMO

customer_reviews.title: I love it!
customer_reviews.text: I love making cinnamon roll waffles and being able to take the plates out to wash is great.
customer_reviews.author: Donna Perez

customer_reviews.title: Great waffle iron for the price
customer_reviews.text: Love this waffle iron. This is the first one I have ever used, so I don't have much to compare it to. But it is easy to use and the waffles come out amazing. They are huge and fluffy. It heats up quickly and is really easy to clean up. The metal plates pop off so you can throw them in the dish washer and the outside wipes clean very quickly. The only thing I didn't consider when I bought it was how much space it takes up. I really don't have a good place to store it, but that's a small price to pay for delicious waffles.
customer_reviews.author: Cls107

customer_reviews.title: Yum yum
customer_reviews.text: This waffle maker is so easy to use and clean. I used to dread making waffles because I could never tell when they were done and they always stuck to the waffle iron. I love the ready light on this one and that it’s attachments are dish washer safe. Highly recommend buying.
customer_reviews.author: M. D.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and clean!
customer_reviews.text: We did a lot of web research and settled on this product due to decent reviews, ease of use and price. We are very pleased with the product. You need to follow directions for first use... lightly oil iron then toss out first wafflle. We have not used anything on the grates since our first use. We find that Krusteaz Belgium Waffle mix ( you add egg and oil to mix) comes out the best. This waffle iron is so easy to use and clean and the waffles come out perfect based on how you choose your setting to your liking. We have had it for a month.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: OK its not industrial grade but for people who like home made waffles occasionally this seems to do the ...
customer_reviews.text: OK its not industrial grade but for people who like home made waffles occasionally this seems to do the trick. You can adjust the crispness of the waffle by a control setting and most important for my wife, you can remove and clean the griddles. At the price whats not to like? I have noticed that while this product like everything else is made in China, Hamilton Beach seems to select the products that bear its name to offer exceptional value and utility. product_meta.title: Hamilton Beach Flip Belgian Waffle Maker with Non-Stick Removable Plates, Browning Control, Drip Tray, Stainless Steel (26030)
product_meta.description:
Style:Non-Stick Removable Plates

HAMILTON BEACH FLIP BELGIAN WAFFLE MAKER 26030
Imagine tasting fluffy, Belgian-style waffles for breakfast every morning. Then, imagine the satisfaction of being able to make a vanilla waffle one day and add nuts, fruit or even dessert toppings to your batter on the next. Now, envision this breakfast experience with no mess and effortless cleanup. You can stop dreaming and wake up, the Hamilton Beach Flip Belgian Waffle Maker is in the kitchen and expecting you for breakfast.

With an ultra flip design, this waffle maker expertly bakes golden brown, fluffy waffles and gives you total flipping control so you can create restaurant-quality results right at home. Make your waffle just the way you want it – lighter or darker – in just minutes. Designed for the thickest batter and most complex waffle, the Hamilton Beach Flip Belgian Waffle Maker has Belgian-style grids with deep pockets to hold plenty of toppings. Even better, the nonstick grids are removable to go in the dishwasher for easy cleanup afterwards.

FLIPS WAFFLES LIKE THE RESTAURANTS PROS
With a little flick of the wrist, The Hamilton Beach Flip Belgian Waffle Maker lets you effortlessly bake, make and flip perfect waffles just like a gourmet restaurant chef. Best of all, the adjustable browning control makes waffles golden brown and crispy on the outside and meltingly tender on the inside. To cook waffles like the best restaurants do, simply preheat the waffle maker until the READY light comes on. Then, pour in waffle batter and flip to lock in place. Waffles are done in 5-8 minutes, depending on the setting and the recipe. Using an oven mitt, flip the waffle maker back and open the cover to a perfect waffle. 

MAKES DELICIOUS WAFFLES 12 DIFFERENT WAYS
If you're craving the sweet and mouthwatering taste of a waffle, but can't decide the flavor or ingredients, you're in good company. The Hamilton Beach Flip Belgian Waffle Maker fits you like a glove. Its deep-grooved waffle grid design is built to handle any type of batter you pour in. Simply choose your recipe and it will handle the rest – effortless flipping, fast, even cooking and browning control. 

PRODUCT FEATURE BENEFITS
 1. Flips easily for thick, fluffy waffles 
 2. Cool-touch, easy-flip handle folds for easy storage
 3. Brushed stainless steel exterior housing ensures long-lasting durability
 4. Advanced heating technology ensures consistent baking and browning
 5. Nonstick finish allows effortless release and trouble-free cleanup 
 6. Removable grids & drip tray are dishwasher safe
 7. Drip tray catches excess batter 
 8. Browning control 
 9. ON and READY lights indicate when power is on and when to add batter

BREAKFAST TREND ON THE RISE
Breakfast isn't called the most important meal of the day without good cause. Jumpstarting your day with a nutritious breakfast has shown to improve mental performance, give you energy and healthy carbohydrates, and help reduce mindless snacking. What's more, where breakfast is prepared and bought has changed over the years. Instead of traditional breakfast meals and times anymore, consumers are now having breakfast at all times of the day, reinterpreting breakfast foods in creative ways and cooking at home. 

SIMPLE CLEANUP
The removable waffle grids are dishwasher safe. To clean the drip tray, rinse off excess overflowed batter with hot water. For easy cleanup and storage, wipe down the exterior with a damp, soapy cloth and fold the handle. Do not use steel wool, scouring pads, abrasive cleansers or sharp or pointed objects on any part, as this will tarnish the steel exterior. 

 COOKING TIPS 
Before pouring batter into grids, always spray them with a small amount of nonstick cooking spray. Waffle color and crispiness are determined by the temperature of the grids, so the higher the temperature, the browner and crisper the waffle. If the cover of the waffle maker doesn't lift up easily, let your waffle cook a little longer before lifting the lid again. To store waffles for later reheating, pack in airtight container and keep in the refrigerator or freezer. 

MIX IN YOUR FAVORITE TOPPINGS & SPICES 
Don't care for plain waffles or need a snazzy new breakfast recipe? Tasting is believing with Hamilton Beach. To mix things up, reduce the amount of batter that you're using and stir one of these sweet treats into the batter before cooking: 

 * Chocolate
 * Maple syrup
 * Cinnamon sugar
 * Fresh or dried fruit
 * Pecans or walnuts

TIP: If using nuts in waffle batter, use chopped nuts and/or evenly spread batter to allow lid to fully close. 

Do not let cord hang over edge of table or counter or touch hot surfaces, including the stove.
